divs: sighting detailsi was outside w\my mom and younger brother watching the neighbors fireworks, when i saw a large, bright, ball that looked like fire to the south. i had no idea what is was and asked my mom. she didn't know either. we were 2 miles north of the city limits of helena,mt the capital city of montana. the object was about 70 degrees above the horizon. the sky was clear and the moon almost full to the east. the object was much smaller than the moon, but much larger than a star or planet. the object moved very slow going north. then it did a round curve to the west. a layer of clouds moved in from the south below it. the object flickered twice, then the object vanished. i first saw it approximately 11:15pm it vanished at 11:18pm i have no pictures or video unfortunately.
